Among the chapters on the collection of matters, the third part of the selection on the causes and conditions, food, truths, and realms, the first of three parts. Thus far, the selection on the classification of places has been explained.
The selection on the classification of causes and conditions, food, truths, and realms.
I will now explain.

In brief, by means of three aspects,
One should understand the distinctions in the establishment of dependent origination.ğŸ”½First, arising from the middle period based on the past period;
Second, arising from the future period based on the present period;
Third, after arising in the present period, continuing to evolve and tending towards purity.
Here, how does one arise from the middle period based on the past period?
And in the middle period, it arises and continues to evolve.
This is like a certain person.
Due to past ignorance, which is not sharp wisdom,
he creates and increases meritorious, evil, and immovable actions of body, speech, and mind.
Due to this as a condition,
the consciousness that follows his actions continues without interruption until the end of his life.
It can be the cause for the continuation of consciousness in the next life.
In this way, it continues.
There is internal and external craving.
When consciousness arises as a result,
it can be a helper.
It arises in the present.
After death,
due to the causes of the previous period,
in the present world,
one's own body is born.
After birth, it gradually continues in the mother's womb.
The consciousness that is a condition for continuation of life continues without interruption.
It sustains the stages of name and form such as kalala,
becoming more and more excellent.
Starting from the womb up to old age.
Moreover, when this consciousness is about to continue in the next life,
the karma that can lead to rebirth gives rise to the result of karmic retribution.
The consciousness that is the result of retribution.
Again, it continues to evolve relying on name-and-form.
This means that it evolves relying on the six bases such as the eye.
Therefore it is said that name-and-form is a condition for consciousness.
The five faculties that arise simultaneously [with consciousness],
are called form.
The immediately past [mental factors], etc., are called name.
According to their respective [functions],
they can serve as the support for the six consciousnesses.
Because consciousness relies on them,
it continues to evolve repeatedly until the end of life.
Moreover, the five material faculties, the great elements that are the basis of the faculties,
the great elements in the location of the faculties,
the various forms that are produced,
and the various other names,
by which the faculties, etc., are grasped,
fall into a continuous stream of evolution without interruption.
These two are collectively called the support that continues to evolve.
Therefore it is said that consciousness is a condition for name-and-form.
Name-and-form is a condition for consciousness.
In the present world, they evolve relying on each other like two bundles of reeds.
Until the end of life, this is how it is.ğŸ”½This is called the dependent origination from the past
to the present.
The various activities are able to arise.

How is it that from the middle period, the arising of the various activities of the subsequent period is obtained?

Because of non-production, purity is realized.
This is how, in the middle period,
the person is born.
Experiencing the two fruits obtained from past karma,
first, experiencing the internal retribution fruit,

or because of the power of past habituation,

Because of delusion regarding the internal retribution fruit,

Because of the power of ignorance regarding the past and future,

In this present life, one acts according to karma.
In this way, because of ignorance as a condition,

Because of activities as a condition,

It should be understood that this consciousness in the present life is only a causal nature.
Because it embraces and receives the seeds of future consciousness as its effect.

Because of the cessation of ignorance,

Because the feelings that arise from the contact of ignorance are permanently eliminated,
craving also ceases.
Because of the cessation of craving.
As explained above, it is called possession, grasping, etc., up to harm as the final end.

in the present world they abide in the nirvÄá¹‡a realm with remaining support.

Up to the body with consciousness abiding has not ceased.

There are no bonds.
That body with consciousness,

This is called the extensive explanation of the establishment of dependent origination by means of three aspects.ğŸ”½That is to say, from the past to the present, there is transmigration.
From the present to the future, there is transmigration.

There are worldly people who are not wise,
who create new karma in the present Dharma, like a small suffering tree.
If those worldly people are not wise,
in the places that accord with the contaminants,

Relying on the future, one single-mindedly fixates on it.

causing the fruit obtained through grasping in the future, as explained above,
to gradually become complete.

Therefore, the wise do not wish to cause the small tree of future existence to flourish.
Then it severs its craving.
Craving conditions grasping and so forth are damaged.
In this way, even a small tree of future existence is made to be completely nonexistent.
How much more so is it made to not increase further.
There is also another person.
The body that has already arisen, all the previously created and increased karma that accords with subsequent experience,

At the time of rebirth in the future,
one abides in name-and-form.

wishes to cause the tree of suffering to grow and flourish.
Herein, the bright aspect should be understood as before.
Furthermore, when the World-Honored One was a bodhisattva in the past,

In order to compassionately benefit and lead other beings,
he himself gave rise to right contemplation of the truths.
At that time, in order to contemplate the truth of suffering,

he contemplated it in reverse order based on dependent origination.

one contemplates old age and death in accordance with reason.ğŸ”½First, because one contemplates subtle conditions.
Second, because one contemplates coarse conditions.

The conditions that give rise to rebirth.
It is also called birth.
The arising of one's own body is also called birth.

The latter birth is coarse.
Here, observing the existence of the subtle birth in the past, there is aging and death.ğŸ”½It is also observed that due to the condition of the coarse birth in the future, there is aging and death.
The subtle birth in the future is the cause of aging and death.
The coarse birth in the present life is the cause of aging and death.
What is meant by not being indeterminate?
It means that apart from the two kinds of birth included in the realm of birth,
there is definitely no other that can give rise to aging and death.
Just as one observes aging and death,
birth, grasping, craving,
each is rationally observed in two ways.
One should know that this is also so.
This is called beginning from aging and death, and observing the two truths of suffering and its origination in reverse order, the principle of dependent origination.
One should know that in this context, the dharmas that accord with the truth of the origination of suffering
are like the wick of a lamp.
This truth of the origination of suffering is like oil, etc.
The truth of suffering is like a lamp.
All those who are not wise individuals,

thus the lamp of suffering burns for a long time.
It should be known that the opposite of this is the bright aspect,
which refers to skillfully contemplating the truths of cessation and the path.
There are also two kinds of individuals.
What are the two?
The first only practices what is not beneficial for oneself,
which refers to gathering wicks and pouring oil only for oneself,
causing the single lamp of suffering to continue for a long time.
The second are other individuals,
who also practice what is not beneficial for themselves and the immeasurable great assembly,
in order to light the great fire of suffering for themselves and others.
Accepting listening to and hearing the wrong teachings as foremost,
the wrong practices induced by the wisdom of hearing, contemplating, and cultivating.
It is like accumulating dry firewood, dry grass, and dry cow dung,
by which,
causes the great fire of suffering to burn for a long time,
without interruption.
Furthermore, when the World-Honored One was a bodhisattva in the past,
and sat on the seat of enlightenment.
Relying on the gate of dependent origination, he entered in reverse order.
First, he contemplated the truth of suffering of old age and death up to craving in the later period in accordance with reason.

He was not yet satisfied.

One should know that in this context,
observing future suffering is the truth of suffering in the future.

Knowing that it exists due to consciousness, which is the limit produced by the accumulation in the past.
The suffering that exists in the present life
Having known that it is produced by the accumulation in the past,

Immediately after this, in order to observe the truth of cessation,
Starting from old age and death, in reverse order,
Up to ignorance.

Observing in this way,
How can the present truth of suffering be completely extinguished?
That is to say, by not creating new karmic actions with ignorance as a condition.
Having thus observed the three noble truths,

Due to the recollection of past abodes as explained before,
Remembering the past, in order to seek the complete extinction of all contaminations, the right view of the world.

for three great eons of incalculable length,

Now, in this meaning, one has already realized it.
For the sake of benefiting others,

Furthermore, the teachings of the Buddha, the World-Honored One, are included in three categories.

First, it is well established that the dharmas that arise from conditions have no function.
Second, because it is the basis for benefiting others.
Third, because it is the basis for benefiting oneself.
Among them, the establishment of the dharmas of dependent origination without activity means:

Are not created by oneself.

Is called the establishment of the dharmas of dependent origination without activity.

Activity and movement
In the ultimate truth, do not exist at all.

It is as it truly is, without error.

is called a body witness.

Next, there are foolish ordinary beings and types of non-Buddhists.
Although they are able to see the coarse impermanence of the body composed of the four great elements,
Because they observe that although this body may remain for a long time, it has increase and decrease,

Free from desire in the form realm up to the peak of existence.

The noble disciples,
Although they have already become skillful in dependent origination,
But only contemplate the subtle impermanence of the body composed of the four great elements.

Why is this?
The body composed of the four great elements can remain for a long time, and its permanent characteristics can be obtained.
It continues in a similar way for a moment,
and its impermanence is difficult to obtain.
The characteristics of impermanence of consciousness are coarse and obvious and can be obtained.
In each moment, the object changes and is released.
Its characteristics transform into countless categories, with differences.
Although the characteristics of impermanence of this consciousness
are of countless categories, coarse and obvious and easy to obtain,
it is still called the most subtle.
One should know that its nature is difficult to recognize
and difficult to enter.
Why is this?
It is only the realm seen by the eye of wisdom.
The body composed of the four great elements has increase, decrease, abandonment, and acceptance.
Its impermanence is still not the realm of the physical eye, let alone the other eyes.
The noble disciples further wish to penetrate the extremely subtle impermanence of consciousness.
They contemplate the principles of dependent origination in the correct way.
Because they are able to discern the distinctions in the states of feelings produced by contact that occur within their own continuity.
They are then able to penetrate the impermanence of consciousness.
Having accomplished such wisdom and insight,

First, the basis of suffering;

These are called the three aspects.
What are the three periods of time?
First, the present period.
Second, the past period.
Third, the future period.
These are called the three periods of time.
One should know that in this context, the suffering of the internal body is based on

Because of its existence,
they arise in the supported body.

Furthermore, through five aspects,
One observes dependent origination with right effort and skillful means.
One can end all suffering and make an end to suffering.
What are the five?
First, observing the causes and conditions for the arising of dependently arisen dharmas.
Second, observing the causes and conditions for their cessation.
Third, accurately understanding the correct practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
Fourth, practicing the Dharma and following the Dharma.
Fifth, being free from the conceit of superiority in one's realization.
This is called correctly observing and fully accomplishing the results.
Beginning from the future, based on the suffering caused by conditions,
In reverse order, up to consciousness being the condition for name-and-form.
Through four aspects,
One observes, penetrates, and practices correctly.
That is, through two aspects one observes the future:
Because the cause exists, the effect exists.
Because the cause does not exist, the effect does not exist.
Having observed this, one penetrates the non-existence of the cause.
By practicing the correct path,
Having penetrated this, one practices in accordance with the Dharma.
Moreover, one correctly contemplates that in the present world,
because there is the cause of new karma that is not done, not to be done, and not to be further done, due to the condition of ignorance,
the results of karma that is not done, not to be done, and not to be further done, such as consciousness, exist.

this also does not exist.

As long as one does not give up life, one always abides in it.

How does one attain freedom from the conceit of superiority?
It means that at that time one accomplishes the marvelous and pure knowledge and insight that can take dependent origination as its object.

Based on ultimate truth, there is no one who transmigrates.

one tells others:ğŸ”½I have already crossed over doubt and permanently severed the three bonds.
